scopecontent.p: This collection consists of programs to the various performances and special programs staged at the Academy from 1857 to 1972. Represented here are the Philadelphia Orchestra, the Pennsylvania Ballet and various opera companies. Also included are programs and miscellaneous material of the Orpheus Club Concerts, 1872-1945 (3 boxes) and The Cecilian, 1875-1903 (1 box). The latter was a society formed for the study and public performance of choral music. In addition to the programs there are also 19 volumes of scrapbooks, 1850-1881 (with gaps), that consist of ephemera and newsclippings of reviews and announcements of performances as well as special events and programs, including speaking engagements by prominent people such as Edward Everett and Henry Ward Beecher. The earliest volume includes a pamphlet by the American Sunday-School Union in which it concludes that, "the opera is no place for a professor of religion."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
